Reviews.Title: “Dogs ate the bathroom but not the vultures”
Reviews.Author: pauleaston
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking of launching a ‘Motel From Hell’ theme park, then the Rodeway Inn at 4559 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway in Kissimmee, Florida should be your starting point. Having booked in online with no refund, it was either laugh or cry. Fortunately we have a sense of humour. There was a strange smell when we entered our room. It was only when my wife entered the bathroom and closed the door that we sussed it. A dog had eaten the bathroom. I’ll say that again. A dog had eaten the bathroom. At some point, a dog had been locked in the bathroom. It had tried to eat its way out, tearing great chunks from the door-fame, the plaster on the wall and scratching the paint from the bathroom door. See the pics if you do not believe me. This may be the same dog who’s hairs were coating the curtains and plastered on the window itself, or it may have been another dog. Whichever dog it was, it was probably trying to launch itself at the colony of buzzards who live in the back lot next door. We counted eighty plus one morning. The back lot belongs to El Tenampa Mexican restaurant. Every morning the staff walk down the back lot and empty bins of food slops into open dumpsters. The buzzards live in the dumpsters and perch on he trees and lamp posts all around the Rodeway Inn like something out of a Harry Potter film. See pics if you do not believe me. The tile floor went way beyond dirty. It was slippery with grease and God knows what sort of filth. The fridge was knackered, yellow and made a clunking noise. The microwave was burned on the front door and something orange had burned itself onto the interior. The sink leaked so they put a plastic bowl on the floor. The bath plug did not work so they fixed it. And left us a spanner so we could fix it ourselves if the problem recurred. The window mounted air-con was installed in the 1960’s then it got into a fight with Jean Claude Van Damme and it lost. The swimming pool was a nest of wind-blown rubbish, some of which came from the vultures camp next door. Insects were less of a problem due to the lizards and long black snakes who live in the rubbish strewn ‘garden’ surrounding the pool. Truly, this place is a nature lovers paradise. If you love vultures, snakes and lizards. I could go on…. But West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway is packed with decent budget motels from as little as $178 a week and I am sure they are fine. They would really have to work at it to be worse than the Rodeway Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Of The Vultures!”
Reviews.Author: tanya c
Reviews.Content: Ok pulled in the parking lot, and was leary at first glance. Pics of hotel not the same in person as online. There were 2 big vultures when we pulled in the parking lot that could have easily carried off my 4 yr old. Couldnt find the pool n when they explained the directions on how to get there was taken by this horrible stench beside the pool, There was all kinds of stuff floating in this pool. "The laundry Service" was an old washer n dryer placed outside next to a wall.The cont breakfast room was mis matched card tables n chairs..I would have rathered wrestle Norman Bates than to sleep in any one of those rooms. Place was dirty and gave me the major creeps. Was told I would still have to pay for one night even if I didnt stay I said fine just let me get out of here.Only thing good was the girl at the desk was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Keep on moving!”
Reviews.Author: sadie f
Reviews.Content: I live by the rule of " as long as its clean" we can stay. I couldnt even say that about this place. The walls had sticky brown residue on them the shower curtain had mold, the beds werent changed from the last people staying in them (we pulled the blanket down to see a pee stain UNDER a towel) When we complained we were told by the OWNER of the motel that we were the ones who did all those things and if we wanted it cleaned WE needed to clean it! There were so many other things broken in our room like the air conditioning, lightbulbs the shower etc but I hope you do not make the same mistake I did by "giving it a try" its not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “WORST EXPERIENCE EVER”
Reviews.Author: ptawbush
Reviews.Content: When others say "don't go," now I understand what they mean. I had paid for a non-smoking ground floor room. I prepaid for this room online (Bad Mistake). When I got there, I was told my room was on the top floor and it was a smoking room. The girl told me the man William, who I had spoken with that morning had lied to me. She was rude and said that I could not get a refund. The worst cusomer service I have ever experienced. Very frustrating! After seeing the hotel, I would not have wanted to stay anyway. Very old and run down, the lobby was dirty. Very bad experience! I had to go and pay for another hotel for 2 nights. My advise would be DON'T DO IT- unless you are up for a lot of frustration.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: Arlette S
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. Old and nasty rooms. Not a very nice crowd it looked to me like a prostitute and a pimp. Guy at the front desk super rude, not willing to help with anything. Room was horrible, carpet was nasty, the bathroom was so dirty that I did not allow my kids to take a shower, sheet and towels smelled horrible. Do not book this hotel, horrible, horrible, horrible and nasty, nasty, nasty. Paid for 2 nights and left after staying there for 3 hours could not stand the smell inside the room and was afraid my car was going to be broke into or even my room. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Worst in 30 yrs”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: bugs, gates, warnings, not a nice place choice brand should sell this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Save your money, better choices for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: y2quest
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel by accident. I really meant to book a room at the Rodeway inn 3 miles away from this one (Rodeway Inn Maingate) and I found out very quickly that not all rodeway inn's are built the same. Rodeway maingate is a much better hotel than this one and they are about the same price. I'm not a picky guy when it comes to hotels but this Hotel seemed really grimy, and dirty. The room was non-smoking but still smelled really bad, It smelled like a combination of smoke and dirty mops. The bathroom looked really old and the shower curtain had mold on it!!! YUCK! The room had 2 TVs one worked and the other one didn't, and of course the only remote in the room was to the TV that didn't work. while brushing my teeth I saw a roach run by my foot like he was running a marathon, very disgusting! The wifi didn't work and the room had a very nice view of a weed garden! the place just looks bad over all. The only good thing was the price and the lady at the front desk was very polite. other than that the place sucked!! I Know I shouldn't expect much for the price paid but as I said in the beginning of this review the rodeway maingate just up the road is much, much better and about the same price and the funny thing is both hotels are run by choice hotels, so I don't understand way this one has been neglected so badly. would I stay here again? No, I rather pay 10-20 bucks more on another hotel than ever give this hotel an other try. The only way I would stay here again is if someone else paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hell of a stay”
Reviews.Author: Alvaro C
Reviews.Content: Dirty, shower works once in a while, old, awful customer service.... If you have the option to stay in any other place DO IT! It´s true that is cheap, but the hotel should pay you if they want you to stay there. the only good thing it has is the wireless internet access, but this time is only helping me share with you my frustration and desire to leave this place. This is like the motel is the horror movies that are dirty, old and looks like a murder happened a while ago. The good comments posted should be from the owners mother, there is no way to somebody likes this place

Reviews.Title: “2nd time back and still great bargain”
Reviews.Author: wendy5o4
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time back here and we enjoyed the hotel for the rate and the fact that it include breakfast, free parking and a swimming pool. We were in Orlando for about 5 days, but we didn't stay in our room about 80% of the time so we didn't mind this place wasn't 4-5 star service. Check-in went smoothly and our room was perfectly fine. Next time though, we'll opt to stay at the ground level so we don't have to haul our luggage to the 2nd floor. Overall, decent stay and would recommend to budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury stay for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Cbento5
Reviews.Content: Disappointed no fridge, no iron, no microwave. Brought a snack for later, went out for an hour ants all over it had to throw it away.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!! Desk Clerks Are Rude, Rooms Are Filthy!!”
Reviews.Author: Christophe2211
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby to check-in, it's likely that the desk clerk will ignore you, probably roll their eyes, and definitely not smile. You have to get their attention. Like most small, dirty hotels run by unqualified managers, the lobby has a foul odor, kind of like cat urine but WORSE!! And it's like no one actually does their job to the clean the rooms. The outside looks okay, but the inside is your worst hotel nightmare. I'd rather stay at haunted psych house than here!!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE... stay somewhere else...anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2HaPeCampers
Reviews.Content: This wasn't the first time that my wife and I stayed here. The first time was fine, the second time my wife came home with itchy bumps all over her legs and was on meds for 2 weeks. We thought that it was something that she ate. We just stayed there again on Thursday and Friday Night. First night... a roach flew out of the door as soon as we opened it. Thought that it must have been from outside. The room smelled damp and the rug was so dirty. We wouldn't walk around without our shoes on. The second night we noticed large ants walking on the walls. Killed them and laid down to go to sleep only to find more ants in the bed. It was midnight but we couldn't take it anymore and checked out. The man at the front desk, EUGENE, was very rude and wouldn't even hear us out. Didn't offer us another room, not that i would have taken it... but still .. he should have offered it. I paid cash but these people have 4 charges pending on my check card.. They said they would drop off in a few days. My wife looked at her legs when we got in the car and she was covered in red bumps again. We drove through the night and got home at 4am. Paid for 2 night and stayed 1.,, This place looks like it's falling apart.. which it is. It's a health hazard. The haven't heard the end of this yet!!!!!!!!!!!! Please stay anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smell bad”
Reviews.Author: bansterref
Reviews.Content: the rug was dirty the room mess and the bathroom did not work.

Reviews.Title: “You will probably die if you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SneakersOToole
Reviews.Content: Yes, that sounds extreme, but it is quite true, I'm afraid. It is just absolutely horrible. Few words can describe how disgusting it is. The shower curtain was so covered in mildew that one could easily mistake the mildew for some kind of intended design. Mold and mildew to me are worse having no TV or a broken A/C. It KILLS. It causes HUNDREDS of types of cancer and respiratory problems. Also awkward was that there was a Mexican gentleman wearing a wife-beater undershirt and boxer shorts, doing all of his laundry in the OUTDOOR washer/dryer units. Looked like he was doing a month's worth of laundry. And then there's the pool. You might want to take a handful of antibiotics BEFORE you get in the pool, because you will surely need them later. Also of comedic value was this: in the lobby, they have a little area in the corner designated as the "Internet Station". It consisted of an old Packard Bell computer from around 1994, small, old-school tube monitor, and a bunch of cables that looked like one of those rubber-band balls. And none of it even worked. But the way it was all just shoved in the corner, was not operational, and was being touted as the "internet station", was pretty funny to me. I felt so dirty after staying here. I'm just glad I didn't die.

Reviews.Title: “Peculiar surroundings...but great value”
Reviews.Author: johnfart
Reviews.Content: All in all, pretty great value for $150 per week. Place wasnt all too bad. Guy at front desk had a killer porn 'stache. Hotel is located behind a disgusting Indian restaurant and a sickening Mexican restaurant. We stayed there a week and I never saw either place get a customer. In the parking lot there are massive carnivorous Vultures that sit on the power lines waiting for fresh meat. I couldnt muster the courage to subject myself to the hotel's outdoor pool. I think someone may have defecated in it. On the first floor, what appeared to be a large Panda bear (later turned out to be a shy asian woman) was living (as in long term) in a room complete with racks of dishes, appliances, extra furniture, and food. We discovered a massive centipede in our bathroom one morning. When I checked in to the hotel, I was required to sign a few documents claiming i was not a prostitute, sexual predator, or convicted sex offender. I clogged our toilet 4 days in a row (small pipes??). Other than all that fun stuff, hotel was a gas to stay at. Close to Boston Market too!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: sissie423
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Has BED BUGS...... we stayed here once before and no problems. We went to Disney for the long weekend. Daughter woke up with small itchy bites. We checked the seems of the bed but did not see any signs of them...... Please beware of this !!!!!!! Just found out that this was what the bites were. Have not notified Hotel yet....... Deals are always not your best friend.....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place I Have Ever Stayed”
Reviews.Author: cotillion1
Reviews.Content: Filthy beyond belief. Trash/blankets/bedspreads sopping wet in courtyard. Grounds overgrown with weeds. Construction debris-but no construction going on. THE BEST PART!!! NO HOT WATER. I called the front desk and he told me how to turn on the faucet. I told him I was familier with faucets. He then told me-and I quote "Go to Pool". I don't want to bathe in a swimming pool. Especially an outdoor pool in 55 degree weather. Totally bizarre people. The mgr later told my husband on the phone that a water pipe had broken. If a pipe had broke there would not have been any water at all. I would sleep in my car before I stayed here again. We paid for 2 nights but only stayed one. Totally gross, unhealthy, disgusting, makes you want to slap somebody place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, but it's not that bad”
Reviews.Author: andy1278
Reviews.Content: Going in knowing this was indeed a cheap hotel, it was worth the price we paid. The front desk service was friendly and nice, as was the housekeeper. The room had a bit of an odor to it - the same smell my apartment used to have when I coated the floor in pet odor powder. It wasn’t overpowering, but it was noticable. The toilet seat was stained, but I think it was just from age. The beds were comfortable, the pillows alternated between okay and possibly being rocks inside of pillowcases. The free wi-fi worked great, with three signals my laptop could pick up in the area from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: indianladynewarkDE
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to disney orlando and we planned everything well. We booked a room at this rodeway inn with kitchen facility which worked well for us. Room tarriff was very attractive and room was cozy and comfy. It also had a swimming pool which we did not get time to use. But overall, best hotel to stay at such a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach hell!”
Reviews.Author: Slayergrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights with my Mother and cousin. Came back into the room on the 2nd night and roaches were climbing the walls. They were in the tub, fridge, chest of drawers. went to the front desk to complain and was told that they have just fumigated that morning. They gave us another room and same thing. Roaches everywhere! One crawled across my cousins foot! We were booked for a full week. Went to the desk for a refund and was told no. Left to find another hotel. went back the next day to speak with management. Older Asian woman screamed at my cousin and I to get the hell out of her Motel and never go back. Wrote a letter of complaint to the Quality Inn hotel group and never got a response back. Please drive right on by this place and find something cleaner! I will never ever stay at another Quality inn group hotel or motel chain again!

Reviews.Title: “No Frills”
Reviews.Author: texcoach
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no frills lodging. Inconvenient location, inadequate complimentary breakfast, etc. On the plus side, very clean rooms, and one friendly helpful desk attendant. Would not recommend it to anyone, there are very many better choices for moderately priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: la-gski
Reviews.Content: To avoid any confusion- this review is for the Rodeway Inn at 4559 W Irlo Bronson Mem Hwy- Knowing there is more than one Rodeway in Kissimmee, when I contacted the Hotel, my first inquiry was if this was the same Rodeway Inn we had previously stayed at in June. Upon giving Victoria a name, she verified our address on file, confirming this was indeed the same hotel. I preceded to book two rooms for two nights each and for that reason, Victoria offered us the "Coupon Rate" of $29.95 per night, instead of the "regular $37 rate." (this was greatly appreciated, as we were not travelling to Kissimmee for fun and lesiure, but to attend funeral services and our funds were extremely limited due to this unexpected event) Upon arrival at the blue and white Roadway Inn on Rt. 192, where we stayed in June, we are told we have no reservations. After a few phone calls made by the clerk, she tells us our reservations are at the OTHER Rodeway Inn. Since some of the family was staying at the Howard Johnson next door, we had even more reason to want to stay at THIS hotel. Major confusion and disappointment. I am allowed to phone the OTHER Rodeway, in an attempt to cancel those reservations and just settle for paying the higher rate here. The "Acting General Manager" informs me that we will be charged for one night for each reservation, as they have a 48 hour cancellation policy- which Victoria neglected to tell me about. So, we are now forced to go to the OTHER Rodeway. As we pulled into the parking lot, I was overcome with this feeling of unease. This building resembled a crack-shack. This building looked unfit for rats to occupy. We went from the clean, neat, big blue and white Rodeway, to the rundown, dilapitated shanty that looked like something uprooted straight out of slums of Tijuana. I was very short with the "Acting GM" Tom Boyle, stating to him exactly what his new employee said to me on the telephone the night before. Oddly enough, Mr. Acting GM could find no record of us ever staying in this Rodeway Inn previously. No, he will not waive the charge to cancel our second reservation. (our other party gave up and went to the Howard Johnson) BUT offered to cancel our second night. We are now left with no choice but to register in this dump. (Also note that during this time in the closet- sized lobby, there was what I assume to be a member of the staff hanging around dressed in what appeared to be some type of pajama outfit, shorts and a midriff top, mumbling loudly) Our debit card is swiped, for our now one-night stay. I inquire about security at the hotel. "Yes, there is security 24 hrs a day" replies Mr. Acting GM. Let's clarify this a little more- 'security' at this Rodeway Inn means nothing more than a staff member, not a security guard, just an all-around-do-everything-employee. At this point, I feel an overnight stay here may just terrorize my children. Now, here's the kicker... Mr Acting GM now passes a piece of paper over the desk that requires a signature. This paper shows the charge to our debit card of $63!! "Room rate and tax" says Mr Acting GM. Informing him that Victoria quoted me a rate of $29.95, the Coupon Rate, I get in response "Did you read the coupon? Do you have the coupon?" (Did he miss the part where I said I spoke with Victoria on the telephone and she offered this rate? how would I have read a coupon?) His apologies were empty, pretentious and hollow at best. Asking for an address to write to the Owner of this property, I am told I can just send it to the hotel--- I'd be willing to bet my last dollar that the owner would never see my letter. We left this hotel after tossing the paper back to Mr. Acting GM and being screamed at by the Pajama Lady- my ear is still hurting. Going to just settle at the Howard Johnson. But alas... our debit card declines, and a quick call to the bank tells us there is a pending charge of $250. We arrived at the funeral home nearly 2 hour late dressed in the clothes we travelled in, and drove two hours home for the night (Lucky for us we had some cash on us to fill up the tank to even get home)

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't let me dog sleep here.”
Reviews.Author: bobalay
Reviews.Content: I decided on a last minute trip to Disney instead of taken my kids to Story Land again this year and my travel agency booked me a vaca package, hotel, air fare, & car rental for one week 7-5-08 thru 7-10-2008. I arrived at the Rodeway Inn Saturday morning which was easy to get to from the airport but when I turned into the parking lot and saw what it actually looks like not the touched up photoshop images you see online I didn't even want to stop. You get unsettling feeling about your safety as soon as you look at the place. I went in with my wife to check in and grab the Orlando brochures. The person who checked us in was very nice but tough to understand because of her broken english. The breakfast area is opposite of the check-in counter just turn around after you check in and your at the breakfast table. It is a tiny room with three little square tables, folding chairs, a microwave and coffee maker which doesn't looked like it worked at all. We went straight to the room after checking in which was the first room at the top of the stairs which was supposed to be newly renovated. The door is barely held on the hinges, and the door handle and lock were flimsy. When I opened the door the first thing I got was a punch in the face with a strong odor, my wife and I best describe it as a mix of smoke, damp cellar, & pesticide. The odor was very strong I wasn't going to breathe that in never mind let my kids. The carpet was pulled up at the door and it was dirty and damp. The night stand between the beds was all marked up with cigarette burns. We pulled the covers back off the beds and although they were made one had hair on it. The bathroom was so small you do have to get in the tub to close the door. The toilet seat was all discolored (very nasty) the shower curtain was all full of mold and the dome light cover was half full of bugs. The sink which is outside the bathroom also had hairs in it. I got everyone out and headed just a few miles up the road to hotel plaza and rented a beautiful room at the Best Western, which was walking distance from downtown Disney and about 4 miles from WDW. I dropped off all my luggage in my new hotel and went right back to the Rodeway Inn and checked out. There was a different lady at the counter this time which spoke much better English and was also very nice, the first lady that checked me in did walk by while I was checking out and she had her hands full of laundry so I don't know if the people who check you in and out also do the laundry? When Leaving I tried going all the way around the hotel just to get a glimpse at the pool but I never did see a pool if there was one it was very well hidden and you can't go around the back because it's a dead end there are other businesses back there it looks like the back of a restaurant not a pleasant view, and to put the icing on the cake the Stop sign in the parking lot on your way out is all hand painted red and the word stop was painted on freehand in white. This place is an absolute dump avoid it all all costs. You don't travel all the way down to Florida to stay at a place like this the streets in Florida are much cleaner than the Rodeway. Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: debbie42467
Reviews.Content: This place is okay if you don’t sleep on the beds and don‘t worry about safety. Hotel address: 4559 Irlo Bronson Mem. Hwy, Kissimmee, FL Photo number 1 is the door. The gold lock on top of the handle would not work, it was missing a piece. The lock below the handle also did not work. When we went to sleep I pushed the table and chairs up to the door. Photo number 2 Two double beds. You will noticed that I brought my own pillows. The room looks like it was freshly painted and the furniture looked rather new, but you will be surprised when you see the blankets. Photo number 3 is the photo of the blanket on one of the beds. Notice the huge stains. Both beds had blankets with these huge stains. Photo number 4 is the bathroom. If you needed the use the restroom you will need to keep the door open. You couldn’t sit on the toilet and close the door. Photo number 5 is a photo of a bathroom towel. It’s hard to see it in this photo, but if you look closely you will see a long black hair on this bathroom towel. I have short red hair. Pros: Friendly staff Price (I used my reward points) Pool (both pros and cons) Freshly Painted Cons: Location, it behind a restaurant. We were using the pool and there were two restaurant employees outside smoking straying at use. Pool area had trash all around, patio furniture broken Door security locks doesn’t work Filthy blankets (and bring your own pillows too) Can’t close bathroom door if you are sitting on the toilet you will need to first get in the tub and then you can close the door. Hotel website shows a photo and says that all rooms has a refrigerators and a microwaves. Our room did not have a microwave. Took 20 mintues to check in, there was only one person infornt of me.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a translator”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was horrendious! No one seemed to speak English and if they did they didn't know any answers to our questions. They advertise Wireless Internet, yea in thier tiny, stuffy front desk area with a kitchen table to sit at. But depending on who you talked to you can have it added to your room for $13 a day, oh no it's free, oh we don't offer that to the rooms, yes all the rooms have it, no none of the rooms have it but if your room is near the office you might be able to get it. Housekeeping did a pretty good job, if they remembered to clean your room. for $20 more a night go stay at a Disney Resort.

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Kissimmee
HotelInfo.Address: 4559 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, Kissimmee, FL 34746
